page.title: 07WHALES AT BONAR BRIDGE
page.content: {In October 1927}a school of{false {killer whales}was sighted in the Dornoch Firth by a keeper at Fearn. It is thought that the leader whale was shot and the rest of the whales lost their bearings and were stranded by the tide on the shore from Bonar Bridge to Ardgay. At that time it was thought that false killer whales were extinct.The whales were towed by boat to a temporary whaling station at the Doune of Creich, where they were cut up and disposed of. Two of the whales were sent to museums in London and New York.
